subject: Philosophy
title: Existential Anxiety
description: A short lesson to help you apply Existential Anxiety.

hook.text: You stand at the edge of a cliff. The dizziness isn't fear of falling â€” it's fear of jumping.

buildup.text: Kierkegaard called this 'the dizziness of freedom.' Anxiety arises from having limitless choices.

discovery.text: Existential anxiety isn't about specific threats. It's about the sheer openness of your future.

twist.text: You can't cure it, and you shouldn't try. Anxiety is the price of being aware of your own freedom.

climax.text: Heidegger said anxiety reveals the truth: your life is yours to shape, and that's overwhelming.

punchline.text: Anxiety is freedom felt from the inside.

quiz.question: According to Kierkegaard, what causes existential anxiety?
options: The overwhelming awareness of limitless freedom
